sect1.title: Setting Options to the SOAP Endpoint

simplelist.member: To enter path of the endpoint (if new is created) upon edit this field is read only
To enable XML-RPC to SOAP filter
Select appropriate user account (having SQL access) to execute the SOAP calls.

sect1.para: Note that if new user is leaved as 'none', and there are stored procedures exposed on the endpoint, a new user account will be created. This automatically generated account has no login access, it can be used only to execute SOAP calls.
The "Authentication Options" allows to specify HTTP athentication options:

simplelist.member: Realm value - string which is used as a parameter for 'Authentication function'.
Authentication function - stored procedure to perform authentication.
Post-processing function - stored procedure to perform post processing.
Authentiction options - name value pairs presented as 'name=value;' in the text area.
ServiceName - Name of the service.
Namespace - value of the service namespace URL.
HeaderNS - value of the default namespace for messages in SOAP Header.
FaultNS - value of the default namespace for messages in SOAP Fault.
MethodInSoapAction - required format of the SOAPAction HTTP header value.
CR-escape - to preserve or not the CR character.
elementFormDefault - default form of literal messages.
DIME-ENC - to present or not DIME encapsulation extensions in WSDL.
WS-RP - enable WS-Routing Protocol filter.
wsrp-from - mail address of the Endpoint administrator for WS-Routing Protocol messages.
Enable or disable WS-Security filters.
To set a stored procedure for key instance generation and XML Signature template generation.
To set validation restrictions for incoming messages.

sect1.para: The "Exposed Procedures" allows to publish and unpublish stored procedures as a SOAP methods.
